Fly, Stay & Cruise Alaska - World Travellers Find your nearest store Destinations Our Deals About Blogs Contact Us SIGN UP Alaska Fly/Stay/Cruise Package 14 Nights | Auckland Roundtrip Embark on a breathtaking journey through Alaska’s untamed beauty with Cunard, where majestic landscapes, glacial wonders, and rich cultural heritage come together in an unforgettable voyage. Sail through the awe-inspiring Glacier Bay and the majestic Hubbard Glacier, two of Alaska’s most iconic natural treasures. These icy giants—set within a UNESCO World Heritage Site—offer dramatic scenery and unforgettable moments, from towering ice walls to the thunderous roar of calving glaciers crashing into the sea. As you explore this remarkable region, encounter Alaska’s abundant wildlife, including whales, bald eagles, sea otters, and bears in their natural habitats. Your voyage also takes you to charming coastal towns like Ketchikan, Skagway, Sitka, Wrangell and Icy Strait Point, where rich Native heritage, frontier history, and thrilling adventures—like glacier flights, dog sledding, and salmon fishing—await. On board, immerse yourself in Cunard’s signature elegance, where refined comfort, exceptional dining, and enriching activities elevate every moment at sea. From pristine wilderness to vibrant local culture, this is a journey you’ll never forget—Alaska, the Cunard way. Deal Details Travel Dates 09 July 26 Sale Ends Nov 30, 2025 Priced From $6,780 per person Enquire Now Description Embark on a breathtaking journey through Alaska’s untamed beauty with Cunard, where majestic landscapes, glacial wonders, and rich cultural heritage come together in an unforgettable voyage. Sail through the awe-inspiring Glacier Bay and the majestic Hubbard Glacier, two of Alaska’s most iconic natural treasures. These icy giants—set within a UNESCO World Heritage Site—offer dramatic scenery and unforgettable moments, from towering ice walls to the thunderous roar of calving glaciers crashing into the sea. As you explore this remarkable region, encounter Alaska’s abundant wildlife, including whales, bald eagles, sea otters, and bears in their natural habitats. Your voyage also takes you to charming coastal towns like Ketchikan, Skagway, Sitka, Wrangell and Icy Strait Point, where rich Native heritage, frontier history, and thrilling adventures—like glacier flights, dog sledding, and salmon fishing—await. On board, immerse yourself in Cunard’s signature elegance, where refined comfort, exceptional dining, and enriching activities elevate every moment at sea. From pristine wilderness to vibrant local culture, this is a journey you’ll never forget—Alaska, the Cunard way. Pricing Oceanview Stateroom (Cat EF) From $6,780* per person, twin share Balcony Stateroom (Cat BE) From $7,259 per person, twin share (pictured) Cruise departs Seattle 9 July 2026. What's Included Return Economy Class Airfares flying Air New Zealand to Seattle from Auckland One-night pre cruise accommodation in Seattle at The Edgewater Hotel (4 Star) in a City View Room 11-night cruise onboard Queen Elizabeth from Seattle return Including Meals, Entertainment & Cunard Signature Experiences onboard Two nights post cruise accommodation in Seattle at The Edgewater Hotel (4 Star) in a City View Room Itinerary Details Day 1: Fly Auckland to Seattle, Washington, USA Day 2: Seattle, Washington, USA Day 3: At Sea Day 4: Ketchikan, Alaska, USA Tiny Ketchikan is just three miles long and three blocks wide, but here you can be sure to find Alaska’s busiest waterfront buzzing with boat planes, fishing boats, pleasure craft, and busy fishermen. Day 5: Glacier Bay National Park, Alaska, USA (Scenic Cruising) There’s so much to take in on a Glacier Bay National Park cruise, it’s hard to know where to begin. Towering mountains, gargantuan icebergs and majestic glaciers stretch as far as the eye can see, disappearing onto the horizon in every direction. It’s a thrilling sight to experience from the deck of a cruise ship, or snuggled under a blanket in the warmth of your stateroom balcony, as you silently watch the world go by. Day 6: Skagway, Alaska, USA Gateway to the Klondike, with highlights including White Summit Pass and the cable Yukon Suspension Bridge. The gold rush coastal town of Skagway, Alaska, was previously a lawless Wild West outpost. Even today, frontier-style saloon-style buildings still line the town’s streets, an enduring reminder of this key period in Alaska’s gold rush history. Day 7: Hubbard Glacier, Alaska, USA (Scenic Cruising) The largest tidal glacier in North America, Hubbard Glacier is a rarity; an icy abyss, formed over centuries, where nature, not man, is King. Only by cruising alongside it can you appreciate the majesty of its colossal scale. It’s a sight quite unlike anything else, drawing the curiosity of visitors keen to experience one of the natural world’s most humbling creations. Day 8: Icy Strait Point, Alaska, USA Icy Strait Point is a grand idea brought to life in a brilliant hub of Alaskan action and adventure. Look out for whales in the picturesque wilderness or enjoy warm hospitality and hearty food ashore. Day 9: Sitka, Alaska. USA Sitka is a hidden beauty on the east coast of Baranof Island in southeast Alaska. Towered over by snowy mountains in the distance, it has previously been known as the Indian River Park and Totem Park. Day 10: Wrangell, Alaska, USA Nestled between Ketchikan and Juneau, Wrangell is one of the oldest towns in Alaska. Explore it’s rich and varied history. Day 11: At Sea Day 12: Victoria, BC, Canada Nestled on the southern coast of Vancouver Island, British Columbia’s capital city, Victoria, is an intoxicating blend of historic streets, Victorian architecture and dramatic craggy coastlines. Here you’ll find a perfect balancing act between old and new, where the legacies left by indigenous populations are imprinted alongside fairy-tale castles and gardens that stay in bloom year-round. Day 13: Seattle, Washington, USA Arrive in Seattle and disembark your ship - Over night Seattle Day 14: Seattle, Washington, USA Day 15: Fly Seattle to Auckland Your Ship Step aboard Queen Elizabeth and be swept away by her timeless art deco elegance, gleaming chandeliers, and refined style. This beautiful Queen offers an uncrowded world where spacious decks, luxurious accommodations, and endless entertainment create the perfect setting for an unforgettable Cunard experience. From world-class dining and captivating performances in the Royal Court Theatre to a leisurely game of croquet on the Games Deck or a moment of serenity in the elegant conservatory, every detail is designed to delight. With Queen Elizabeth, every voyage is as remarkable as the ship herself. Terms & Conditions T&Cs: Pricing is correct as of 04 November 2025. Valid for sales to 30 November 2025 unless sold out prior. Exclusive Package Pricing via Infinity Cruise, that must be packaged with Airfares + minimum 3-nights 4 star + accommodation. Cruise pricing based on Balcony (BE) stateroom or Oceanview Stateroom (EB). Gratuities of USD16 per person per day are additional and payable onboard. Airfares: Return economy class airfares based on Air New Zealand SHSVAM Departing AKL via SFO / SLSVAM departing SEA via SFO. Accommodation: Pre cruise accommodation is based on check in 08 Jul 2026 for one night, post cruise accommodation is based on check in 20 Jul 2026 for two nights. A mandatory resort fee of USD33 + tax per room per day is additional and payable direct on arrival. Experience the world differently.
